prompt:
Nurse: I'm glad to hear that, Mr. Delarosa. How about a new or worsening dry cough?

Patient: No.

Nurse: That's good to hear, Mr. Delarosa. Now, have you noticed any increased swelling in your feet, ankles, stomach, or legs?

Patient: No. I haven't.

Nurse: That's great, Mr. Delarosa. Have you gained more than 2 pounds in the past day or 5 pounds in the past week?

Patient: No. I've been weighing myself every day.

Nurse: That's excellent, Mr. Delarosa. Regular weight checks are a good way to monitor your health. Lastly, have you been using more pillows at night to sleep?

Patient: No. I haven't.

responses.gpt4: That's good news, Mr. Delarosa. It seems like you are doing well in managing your symptoms at home. This simple CHF assessment is something you can also do daily. It's quite helpful in tracking any changes. Would you have any questions about how to monitor your symptoms?
responses.our_model: That's good to hear, Mr. Delarosa. We just performed a simple CHF assessment. It's a good idea to do this at home every day. I understand that keeping track of symptoms can be a bit complicated. Do you have any questions about how to do so?
